Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery 'overlap' Siana cup; interior black save a narrow reserved band near top; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of warrior scene (helmet in added red with part of crest and one arm held back, holding spear, of warrior facing left; to his right, part of arm and spear of second warrior, facing right).
Producer name: Attributed to: The C Painter (According to Beazley)
Attributed to: Taras Painter (According to Brijder)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 41)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 370, no. B501)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1320) (phase 3)
